subject: Re: [junit] Is it possible to include javadoc/comments in junitreports?
msgSnippet: ... I m not sure how to do that. Typically, the name of the test is enough to describe what each test means. Why is that not the case for you? -- J. B.
messageBody:
valerie_abelin wrote:

> I'm using Ant to run junit and junitreport. I like the HTML output
> that junitreport generates, but I am wondering if it is possible to
> include more javadoc/comments in the output rather than just the
> success/failure status and time the test took to run. It would be
> great if junitreport could include a comment from the source code
> about what each test means.

I'm not sure how to do that. Typically, the name of the test is enough
to describe what each test means. Why is that not the case for you?
--
J. B. Rainsberger,
Diaspar Software Services
http://www.diasparsoftware.com :: +1 416 791-8603
Let's write software that people understand
